name: Relais Villa Angiolina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Angiolina catered for our needs perfectly during our week long stay in Sorrento. Leana couldn't have been more helpful with any questions or queries that we had. The room was a good size, clean and modern. We were only a five minute walk from the main street. Villa Angiolina seems much better value than the other options in Sorrento.
reviews.title: Great value Villa in the heart of Sorrento

reviews.text: We enjoyed everything about Villa Angiolina. Liana and her family were warm and friendly and accommodated our every need. From the very beginning the communication, directions and expectations were clear. The grounds were lovely and the location was ideal...far enough away from the busyness of town but close enough to walk to the main attractions. Villa Angiolina was our favorite place to stay while on our vacation in Italy.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We (two couplesP spent three nights at Villa Angiolina in May, 2010 and we cannot heap suggicient praise on this jewel of a B&B. It is a family-run operation and the family -- mother, daughter, and two brothers - could not have done more to make our stay with them just perfec, including picking up four weary travelers at the bus stationt. The B&B is built on the property owned by their grandmother and is named after her, Angiolina. Perhaps that explains the great care and attention that were given to the decor, each room being named after a flower (orchids for us), with the orchid theme being carried throughout. The rooms as well as the bathrooms were spacious and well appointed, a rare find in Italy. And it is located a quiet, beautiful setting with flowers everywhere and just a short walk to town. Breakfasts were fabulous with a wide variet of cereals, fresh fruits and breads.But it is the warmth of this family that impresses most. They could not have been more helpful and hospitable and we would highly recommend Villa Angiolina to Anyone. You will not be disappointed. Mary, Chuck, Elizabeth and Joe
reviews.title: A Gem in Every Respect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful stay in the Villa Angiolina and we can recommend it to anyone who wants a quality stay in a beautiful villa with friendly and helpful staff.Actually the staff are the family who own this villa and who care for it and their guests with warm hospitality .
reviews.title: A wonderful experience!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 14 nights and were made feel like part of the family.Our bedroom was spacious and modern and we had a little terrace where we sat out to enjoy a glass of wine every evening.The villa has been completely renovated with first class fittings - plasma TV , huge shower, comfortable bed and safe and mini bar/ fridge. Free Wifi is available. There are lovely gardens tended lovingly by the owner of the villa and his wife bakes delicious treats for breakfast. Their chaming daughter Leana looks after reception and speaks fluent English
reviews.title: A quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most guests stayed for 3 or 4 days so we were the exception but if I were fortunate enough to be in Sorrento again I would stay in Villa Angiolina Incidentally , when we were in Sorrento some years ago we stayed in The Ambasciotori and loved it but the warmth and tranquillity of Villa Angiolina would ensure our return!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: It is just a 5 minute walk to the centre of Sorrento and about 10 minutes to the train/bus terminal and 15 minutes to the ferry port. Leana was very helpful with timetables and suggestions for things to do.
reviews.title: A very well designed apartment

reviews.text: The hotel is run by the family owners who are helpful and accessible for giving advice about local tourist spots etc. The hotel itself however is slightly interior and does not have any bay view. Being a small hotel, locating it could be difficult. It is NOT within walking distance from the railway station especially with luggage. It would be better to insist on the hotel arranging pick-up at least while reaching the hotel for the first time.
reviews.title: An excellent B&B in a peaceful location yet only a few minutes walk from central Sorrento

description: In the heart of Sorrento, a charming gem of the peninsula nestled between the Gulf of Naples and the Amalfi coast, lies the Relais Villa Angiolina historic home restored to new life. A corner of dreamy tranquility where the authentic tradition of the territory, in a craft of stone and lush, combines with the comfort features to give guests the pleasure of welcoming one, in perfect balance between past and future.
